snippet.title: 'Game of Thrones' scorecard: FINALLY
snippet.description:
'Game of Thrones' scorecard: FINALLY by Matt Ufford on Apr 14 2014, 9:20a
All season long, we'll be keeping score in "Game of Thrones." This week's episode delivered one of the more satisfying twists in cable history, but it came at the expense of the show's nudity...

snippet.description:

snippet.title: 2014 NFL mock draft: The cost and risk of trading the No. 1 pick
snippet.description:
2014 NFL mock draft: The cost and risk of trading the No. 1 pick by Dan Kadar on Apr 7 2014, 8:00a
If the Atlanta Falcons want South Carolina defensive end Jadeveon Clowney, general manager Thomas Dimitroff may have to trade with the Houston Texans for the top choice.

snippet.title: When instant replay fails
snippet.description:
When instant replay fails by Grant Brisbee on Apr 2 2014, 12:13p
Looking forward to the human element going away? It's standing behind you with a mallet.

snippet.title: Noah Syndergaard, George Springer, and playing around with service time
snippet.description:
Noah Syndergaard, George Springer, and playing around with service time by Grant Brisbee on Mar 21 2014, 10:54a
There's a system in place that determines how much young players can make and how soon they can make it. Should we be outraged?

Not just wasted time: What do NBA teams do during shootarounds? by Doug Eberhardt on Mar 13 2014, 2:17p
The shootaround has evolved into an essential part of preparing for games. Here's an inside look into what teams actually do during their shootarounds.

snippet.title: Super Bowl 2014: 'We ran into a buzz saw'
snippet.description:
Super Bowl 2014: 'We ran into a buzz saw' by Danny Kelly on Feb 7 2014, 12:00p
The Denver Broncos were stunned by what they saw from the Seattle Seahawks. Maybe they shouldn't have been. Danny Kelly sits down in the film room for a closer look at what had the Broncos on their...
